title: Magnetic flux - loop near current-carrying wire

content.question: A long straight wire carries a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>. The upper wire of a rectangular loop of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and width <math alttext="w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>w</mi></math> is placed a distance <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> below the wire, as shown. What is the magnetic flux through the loop due to the current in the wire?

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, I L, and denominator 2 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, I L w, and denominator 2 pi times, open parenthesis, h plus w, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>w</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, I L, and denominator 2 pi times, times the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction w over h, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>w</mi><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, I L, and denominator 2 pi, end fraction, times the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator h plus w, and denominator h, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>w</mi></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, I L, and denominator 2 pi, end fraction, times the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator h plus w, and denominator h, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>w</mi></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
